channel.title: HIOs on David R. Hill
channel.description: Recent content in HIOs on David R. Hill

item.title: Modeling Neonatal Microbial Colonization in Human Intestinal Organoids
item.description: All multicellular organisms have a problem: surviving in a world that is already fully occupied by bacteria and other single celled organisms. We call this problem symbiosis. The primary solution to this problem is mutualism, which intimately links the survival of individual organisms and as a result has shaped the evolution of both bacterial and multicellular life. This interplay is central to the maturation and function of the human gastrointestinal tract.

item.title: Identification of host-microbial interaction networks that mediate intestinal epithelial barrier maturation
